Desc.entry: A registered charity which provides a 24 hour service offering support and relief to carers of people with a physical or sensory disability, learning difficulty or mental health problems. In Sheffield the scheme provides respite for carers of adults and children with learning difficulties, carers of the elderly and younger dementia sufferers. Support workers will undertake any task usually carried out by the carer, eg dressings, preparing meals. The service may be purchased by individuals or accessed via a Neighbourhoods and Community Care or Children and Young People's Service referral. McMillan Cancer Support fund this service to provide support to the carers of children and adults who have a diagnosis of cancer. This company is registered and inspected by the Care Quality Commission (CQC), to make sure they provide a quality service. Company limited by guarantee no 3537558.
